page.title: 04CROPPING:STENIGOT/ASTERBY
page.content: The cropping in this area is governed by two facts:soil types and viability. Soil types vary from{medium wold overlying{chalk}at 500 feet above sea level,down to{Kimmeridge clay}and blow-away{sand}on the approach to the River Bain.Most of the wold soil types are suitable for growong a variety of crops,these predominantly being Winter {Wheat}Winter and Spring{Barley,}Vining and Dried{Peas,}with smaller areas of {Potatoes, Oilseed Rape,Sugar Beet}and {Brussel Sprouts. The other soil types,from the Wolds to the Bain,are{Tealby Clay}( Winter Wheat, Winter and Spring Barley and { Oilseed Rape.{Sandy Loams}(Winter and Spring Barley,Potatoes{*}and Sugar Beet{*). K.clay}(Winter cereals and Oilseed Rape).Cereal/Rape viability is aided by E.E.C.financial support. {* using irrigation.
